channel.title: ai on frieda rong
channel.description: Recent content in ai on frieda rong

item.title: Benchmarking and evaluation frameworks for reasoning in language models
item.description: A version of the talk given to DGP catered towards self-driving cars.

item.title: Evaluating artificial intelligence (AI) and human reasoning
item.description: A summary presentation of my work on evaluating reasoning across mathematics, creative writing, video games, and card games.

item.title: Value Internalization: Learning and Generalizing from Social Reward
item.description: Accepted to CogSci 2024 and Reinforcement Learning Conference 2024. How can AI agents learn motivations from others and internalise social rewards?

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Models of Tradeoffs Between Infant Attachment and Curiosity
item.description: Member abstract at CogSci 2023. How can we computationally model infant learning and attachment styles?

item.title: Characterizing Learning Progress of Problem-Solvers Using Puzzle-Solving Log Data
item.description: Demo paper at EDM 2023. How do human learners perform on a puzzle video game compared to AI learners?

item.title: Evaluating Human-Language Model Interaction
item.description: Accepted to TMLR 2023. How can we use AI assistants to generate metaphors?

item.title: Holistic Evaluation of Language Models
item.description: †: lead authors *: major contributors endpreamble Accepted to TMLR 2023. How well do large language models perform on the MATH dataset?

item.title: Baba is AI
item.description: A project presentation for the 2022 class of CSLI summer interns on studying the problem-solving process in the video game Baba is You.

item.title: Beyond the Imitation Game: Quantifying and extrapolating the capabilities of language models
item.description: Accepted to TMLR 2023. How well do large language models perform on an unnatural in-context learning task?

item.title: BEHAVIOR feedback: a benchmark for social perception
item.description: A project pitch for how smart agents can interact with us to better understand our goals in household activities by learning individual and cultural diversity.

item.title: On the Opportunities and Risks of Foundation Models
item.description: Please cite using these guidelines. endpreamble What are the next steps in teaching foundation models formal reasoning and using them?

item.title: Generalization of Rules by Neural Nets & Learning Networks of Neurons with Boolean Logic
item.description:
Over the pandemic, our computer science PhD cohort organized a fun, informal reading group to take us back to the classics.

endpreamble

Inspired by all the scaling laws excitement, I coded up a numerical simulation of neural networks before GPUs were popular for science and leaderboard points!

item.title: GeoSim: Realistic Video Simulation via Geometry-Aware Composition for Self-Driving
item.description: Best Paper Candidate at CVPR 2021. How do we combine the best of graphics-based simulation and neural reconstruction?

item.title: [Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models](https://hojonathanho.github.io/diffusion) paper review
item.description: As graciously explained to me by one of the authors, Ajay Jain. (Any errors are mine!)

item.title: Variational Autoencoders
item.description: In addition to research and internship opportunities, I learned about AI through reading and summarizing blog posts and papers, then giving talks like this one.
